meanings.definition: The persistence of sound after its source has stopped.
meanings.sent1: The loud reverberations of the thunder could be heard long after the storm had passed.
meanings.sent2: The reverberations of the bell echoed through the empty hallways.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous students created fake reverberations by playing a recording of thunder during class.
meanings.sent4: The reverberations of her laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The eerie reverberations of footsteps in the old house made it seem haunted.

meanings.definition: A continuing effect or result of an event or action.
meanings.sent1: The reverberations of his decision were felt throughout the company.
meanings.sent2: The reverberations of the earthquake were still being felt weeks later.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected reverberations of her joke caused everyone to burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The reverberations of his speech inspired many to take action.
meanings.sent5: The reverberations of her kindness spread far and wide.
